name: Uncle Bob's Ceviche
author: KIMBERLY ANNE
summary: Uncle Bob makes his ceviche with fresh fish straight off the boat on Catalina Island, but he promises that you'll have good results if you make good friends with your local grocery store's fishmonger, too! Serve with tortilla chips.
ingredients: 1 pound swordfish, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 pound halibut, cut into bite-sized pieces
1 pound squid, cut into thin rings
½ cup bloody mary mix (such as Mr. & Mrs. T®)
½ cup chopped pimento-stuffed green olives
½ cup diced canned jalapeno peppers
¼ cup frozen corn kernels, or to taste
¼ cup frozen peas, or to taste
1 tablespoon ground cumin, or as needed
directions: Put swordfish, halibut, and squid in a large, resealable plastic bag; add lime juice and mix to coat seafood with the lime juice, squeeze bag to remove excess air, and seal the bag
Marinate in the refrigerator 8 hours to overnight
Pour seafood mixture into a large serving bowl
Stir cilantro, bloody mary mix, green olives, black olives, yellow onion, pimento peppers, jalapeno peppers, corn, peas, cumin seeds, and Worcestershire sauce with the seafood mixture
Sprinkle ground cumin over the mixture to cover completely
